title: ONYX STORM
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.

title: MIDNIGHT BLACK
author: Mark Greaney
description: The 14th book in the Gray Man series.  Gentry’s lover, a former spy for Russian foreign intelligence, is imprisoned in a Russian gulag.

title: THE NIGHTINGALE
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two sisters are separated in World War II France: one in the countryside, the other in Paris.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: DEEP END
author: Ali Hazelwood
description: As the pressure leading up to the Olympics builds so do the feelings Lukas and Scarlett have for each other.

title: THE TECHNOLOGICAL REPUBLIC
author: Alexander C. Karp and Nicholas W. Zamiska
description: Two senior leaders at Palantir Technologies enumerate what they see as potential global threats to the United States.

title: SEVEN THINGS YOU CAN'T SAY ABOUT CHINA
author: Tom Cotton
description: The Republican senator from Arkansas delineates what he perceives as threats from China.

title: ON TYRANNY
author: Timothy Snyder
description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.

title: LORNE
author: Susan Morrison
description: A biography of the creator and producer of “Saturday Night Live.”

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: HOW WE LEARN TO BE BRAVE
author: Mariann Edgar Budde

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: AWAY
author: Megan E. Freeman
description: A group of children in a relocation camp investigate why they were driven from their homes. (Ages 10 and up)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: LITTLE LEADERS
author: Vashti Harrison
description: The biographies of 40 African-American women who made a difference. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: BUFFALO FLUFFALO
author: Bess Kalb. Illustrated Erin Kraan
description: A buffalo's posturing is exposed when the rain falls. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LEPRECHAUN
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: This is the year you'll finally catch a leprechaun. (Ages 4 to 10)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: DRAGONS LOVE TACOS
author: Adam Rubin. Illustrated Daniel Salmieri
description: What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: BLUEY: SLEEPYTIME
author: Joe Brumm
description: Bingo wants to do a big girl sleep and wake up in her own bed. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: LIGHTLARK SAGA
author: Alex Aster
description: Every 100 years the island of Lightlark appears and a deadly competition called the Centennial takes place. (Ages 13 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: REBEL WITCH
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune and Gideon must join forces to stop a sinister plot by Cressida Roseblood. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: THE WAY THINGS WORK NOW
author: David Macaulay with Neil Ardley
description: An updated edition looks at how physics intersects with the everyday. (Ages 11 to 15)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)
